metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19813 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image,performing some operations, and then making a syncfs system call can leadto a use-after-free in __mutex_lock in kernel/locking/mutex.c. This isrelated to mutex_can_spin_on_owner in kernel/locking/mutex.c,__btrfs_qgroup_free_meta in fs/btrfs/qgroup.c, andbtrfs_insert_delayed_items in fs/btrfs/delayed-inode.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.10.0-1008-oem - 5.10.0-1008.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-kvm package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1004.4').

linux-raspi package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1007.7').
linux-hwe-5.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1').
